meanings.definition: Moving with quick, short, jerky movements
meanings.sent1: The puppy was jigglier than the older dog.
meanings.sent2: The jigglier branches swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The jigglier dance moves made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her jigglier steps resembled a bouncing ball.
meanings.sent5: The jigglier motions of the toy were captivating.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to shake or wobble
meanings.sent1: The table with the loose leg was jigglier than the others.
meanings.sent2: The jigglier jelly on the plate made it hard to cut.
meanings.sent3: The jigglier bridge made the travelers nervous.
meanings.sent4: His jigglier voice betrayed his nervousness.
meanings.sent5: The jigglier ground made walking difficult.

meanings.sent1: The tower became jigglier as the wind picked up.
meanings.sent2: The jigglier stool was in need of repair.
meanings.sent3: The jigglier boat rocked back and forth on the waves.
meanings.sent4: Her jigglier grip on the handlebars made her lose balance.
meanings.sent5: The jigglier ladder creaked under his weight.
